HR & Business Administrator

About Us
At Close, we're building the sales communication platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we're leading the industry toward eliminating manual processes and helping companies to close more deals (faster). Since our founding in 2013, we've grown to become a profitable, 100% globally distributed team of 40 high-performing, happy people that are dedicated to building a product our customers love. 

Our organization is growing and with each new team member comes additional logistics and responsibilities. Our current People Operations Team (of 1) is looking for someone to own all human resources and business administration.

About You
You have at least five years experience with SMB administration, human resources, executive or personal assistance. You are a Mac user who is comfortable working remotely as part of a small team with a high level of autonomy and exceptional communication skills for this environment. 

You are reliable; people depend on you for stability. You’re the first person friends and family call to help plan/host gatherings and with life-admin related questions (reviewing contracts, obtaining health insurance, doing their taxes).  

You ♥ administrative tasks. Working behind the scenes feels rewarding. Your day-to-day sense of accomplishment comes from checking off tasks and supporting a business, while a long-term sense of accomplishment comes from developing more effective processes.  

Reading the fine print is your forte - you have an exceptional eye for detail.  You know how to anticipate needs and have the confidence to proactively ask for help. 

You practice ruthless prioritization. You know how to effectively manage your time while collaborating and communicating in an asynchronous working environment.  

You have a natural balance of linear and creative mindset; someone that is highly organized yet resourceful and imaginative in solutions. You have integrity, are trustworthy, self-aware.  

You are based in the US or Canada. 

Bonus points for working in a startup environment, accounting or employment law.

About The Job
You will be taking ownership over many existing business and people operation systems while suggesting new practices to improve as we grow. We currently use Slack, Gusto, PurelyHR, G Suite, Dropbox and Confluence to name a few. Most of the work required today involves administrative tasks and organization. 

You will be working with Mary and occasionally Anthony,Steli and Christie. 

The list below should be something you genuinely find enjoyable, as the majority of your day is spent here. You should be familiar with and have the ability to take ownership and responsibility over these areas of the business:  

  • Compliance & registration: city, state, and federal entities 
  • Employee benefits: medical, dental, 401k, HSA, FSA 
  • Finance: payroll, contractor payments and invoices
  • Employee care: tracking PTO, purchasing gifts, celebrating work anniversaries 
  • Business admin: business insurance, workers compensation, tax preparation and business surveys 
  • Asset & subscription management: purchasing, shipping and tracking all laptops and monitors; managing company subscriptions such as zoom and calendly 
  • Onboarding: setting up new hires with all necessary devices, accounts and assisting in onboarding and training 
  • Retreats: research, planning, organization and hosting biannual company off-sites

A ton of other random operational tasks we need your help with at our small company :)

Why Close?

  • 100% remote-first company (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • 2 x annual team retreats ✈️ (Lisbon Retreat Video)
  • Competitive salary
  • 7 weeks PTO (includes company-wide winter holiday break)
  • 1 month paid sabbatical after 5 years
  • $200/month co-working stipend
  • Paid parental leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
  • 99% premiums paid for excellent medical and dental coverage, including an HSA option (US residents)
  • 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
  • Dependent care FSA (US residents)
  • Our story and team
  • Glassdoor Reviews  
At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Life-work harmony is an important part of our organization - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you). 

We come from 13 countries and 16 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community. This team is growing in more ways than one - we’ve recently launched 10 babies (and counting!).

Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.  

 Interested in Close but don't think this role is the best fit for you? View our other positions.

We are looking to bring in a new head of accounting and HR. This is a dual hat role that will be performed entirely remotely from within the US. We currently employe less than 50 people inside the US as well as a handful of international contractors. Our company has been in continual business since 2010. 

Job Duties:
  • Perform bookkeeping duties for all transactions in Quickbooks Online 
  • Pay company taxes, payroll taxes, and other fees in the normal course of business
  • Prepare and file quarterly and yearly taxes under the supervision of an outside CPA firm
  • Collect,  file, sort, and pay invoices from venders and contractors
  • Introduce new employees to our company's benefits such as 401k plans, healthcare, etc
  • Setup new employees with required work system on their first day
  • Manage our vender relationship with benefit providers such as 401k plans and healthcare
  • Manage our relationship with our client's account payable teams
  • Run financial simulations and cash flow models for the business 
  • Work with company employees involving HR and payroll concerns
  • Report directly to the CEO and Board of Directors

Requirements
  • CPA (Preferred)
  • Bookkeeping experience 
  • HR experience 
  • Remote company experience. 
  • Fluency in computers especially Mac and Apple experience 
  • Top notch communication skills both written and spoken
The position is estimated to take 15-25 hours per week on normal weeks, more when on boarding new employees or during tax filing season. This position will be listed as a full time W2 position, though historically we have seen a much lower utilization of hours than the typically 40 hour work week. 

We offer:
  • Competitive salary
  • Paid time off and sick leave
  • Computer computer equipment 
  • Remote work with flexible hours
  • 401k with company matching

We are looking to fill this position very quickly to replace a transitioning team member.

Technical Recruiter

Overview

With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week. Our mission ‘making repeat orders easier for everyone' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe.

With big hiring plans for 2020 and beyond we're looking for an experienced in-house Technical Recruiter to aggressively find and engage talent for our Engineering and Product teams. Reporting to the Director of Talent Acquisition and working closely with internal stakeholders you'll own hiring outcomes and build remote-first teams with a focus on culture fit while providing an exceptional candidate experience.

We're building a powerhouse People Ops department and the Talent Acquisition team will be critical in helping ReCharge identify, attract and hire world-class talent as we scale. If you're smart, a savvy sourcer, can drive hiring discussions and want to be a part of a high growth tech company, we'd love to hear from you.

What You’ll Do
  • Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.
  • Work closely with hiring teams to understand our culture, the requirements for our roles and their impact on the company. 
  • Strategically plan and execute impactful sourcing campaigns that actually work.
  • Find, engage and activate passive candidates through the use of boolean, LinkedIn, etc
  • Build ‘just in time’ talent pipelines of qualified engineering candidates.
  • Screen and qualify passive candidates for experience competencies, culture attributes and core values.
  • Collaborate with teammates on special projects to enhance the employee and candidate experience.
  • Coordinate with hiring teams and candidates to schedule interviews as needed.
What You’ll Bring
  • Typically, 4+ years of recruiting experience working in fast paced technology driven companies
  • 1+ years of technical recruiting experience on an in-house team required
  • Experience driving outcomes and hiring engineering and product candidates
  • Intuitive sourcing skills and a knack for identifying and engaging top engineering talent 
  • Self-directed, with a high sense of urgency and keen eye for details
  • Experience screening candidates by phone or video
  • A motivated, dynamic and curious mind with excellent research skills 
  • Strong experience using LinkedIn Recruiter and an ATS, Greenhouse a plus
  • Desire to work remotely and to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up
  • Prior agency experience or tech start-up experience a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Are you a nonfiction copyeditor looking for a long-term, exciting new gig? We may have the perfect position for you!

We’re seeking exceptional nonfiction copyeditors for a copyediting/line-editing hybrid position. Responsibilities include ensuring that our books read well, are well-polished, error-free, accurate, consistent, cohesive, and complete.

Requirements:

  • You are precise, detail-oriented and skilled in grammar and word usage.
  • You are a native English speaker.
  • You have editing experience.
  • You use style guides when editing.
  • You have open availability and can be reached throughout the day.
  • You can work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment

Our rate is $5 per 1,000 words. Projects range from 10K to 50K words each (average projects are 30,000 words). So, you can make good money on a single project, and with our workflow, we can keep your pipeline full of exciting projects. Once hired, you are not required to apply for or bid on jobs.   • Correcting errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, capitalization, syntax, font usage, numerals, and hyphenation.
  • Rhythm, readability, and pacing.
  • Writing craft: paragraph structure, sentence flow, tense, word choice, and language technique.
  • Voice and style.

People Operations Coordinator – HR Coordinator at Protocol Labs

Remote | Freelance | International

REMOTE

OPERATIONS PEOPLE

CONTRACT-TO-HIRE

We seek a detailed oriented and passionate People Ops Coordinator who is self-driven, independent and motivated to build efficient systems and processes.

People at Protocol Labs

The People Team at Protocol Labs powers our work. Protocol Labs is a product-development lab, but behind the protocols and tools we build, behind the research and spec work, behind our implementations are passionate people, teammates and community members. The people team ensures that the Protocol Labs team remains happy, aligned and productive. Protocol Labs works at the intersection of many exciting fields (crypto, networks, distributed systems) and cultures (startups, research, open source, distributed work). The people team has the challenging and exciting task of taking the best from these cultures to shape the way we work at PL and ensure we all grow as people and professionals. All of this happens in an environment defined by curiosity, passion, and a love for open source.

Responsibilities

  • Champion and facilitate an amazing employee experience at all touch-points of the employee lifecycle
  • Manage our HRIS ensuring it’s up-to-date, providing ad hoc reports extracting data from HR systems and processing new hires and any changes in the system
  • Respond to employee questions regarding policies and procedures
  • Respond to requests for employment verification
  • Help facilitate all visa processes
  • Support and help with ad hoc projects and requests
  • Assist with new hire activities including disseminating new hire documents to appropriate parties, requesting IT access, setting up profiles in HRIS, etc.
  • Constantly look for ways to automate and improve processes
  • Administer offboarding process and internal transfers by supporting HRBPs

Requirements

  • 1+ years of experience as an HR Coordinator or a similar role
  • Detail-oriented with impeccable follow through
  • Experience in startup culture – comfortable with ambiguity and non-stop problem solving, building, and action
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What’s it like to work at Protocol Labs?

Protocol Labs mission is to improve humanity’s most important technology, the Internet. We build protocols, systems, and tools to improve how it works. Today, we are focused on how we store, locate, and move information. Our projects include IPFS, Filecoin, libp2p, and more.

As a distributed team, we hire anywhere in the world, and at various levels of experience (entry, senior, staff). We look for people with unique perspectives and diverse backgrounds.

We have a great benefits package, including parental leave, contributions to your retirement, competitive pay, and unlimited time off. For U.S.-based employees, we also provide platinum-level health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family.

DESCRIPTION

ConvertKit is on a mission to help creators earn $1B using our SaaS email marketing platform. We are 100% independent, 100% remote and are growing rapidly. We are proud to have built a product that our customers love, and we’re looking for a talented People Ops person to contribute to our operations team in a full-time role. If you thrive off connecting with people, managing systems that meet state and federal requirements, care about creating an incredible culture, and have seen rapid growth this might be the role for you!

WHY CONVERTKIT IS INTERESTING:

  • We are a 100% bootstrapped company with a 100% remote team with teammates in 40 cities across 9 countries.
  • Every team member is committed to our mission, vision and values. Our mission is not your standard mailed-in variety; We exist solely to help creators earn a living from their craft, and we take that very seriously.
  • We put a high emphasis on work / life balance.
  • We were named #23 on the 2019 Inc 5000 – the fastest growing private companies in America. We were the #1 fastest growing software company on the list.

REQUIREMENTS

As People Ops, you’ll be responsible for helping us maintain our fantastic culture and scale our people systems and processes as we continue to grow. We’ll give preference to applicants with leadership development and succession planning experience at a rapidly growing company (ideally a software startup). The role reports to the Director of Operations, which reports to the COO.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Teach and coach managers around all aspects of performance management, including career alignment, performance reviews, terminations, and career development plans
  • Help improve team member performance by identifying opportunities for growth and coaching managers and teammates through the process
  • Serve as an advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout our team culture, including our hiring practices
  • Manage benefits & renewals annually (including 401k compliance)
  • Onboard new hires to set them up for success over their first 90 days and beyond
  • Manage and ensure compliance with our hiring and termination process
  • Build on and operate our team wellness program and quarterly book club
  • Manage and issue contracts for vendors and contractors
  • Ensure performance reviews are done timely and consistently
  • Use data, metrics, and analytics to measure success and make better decisions
  • Lead strategic people and culture initiatives (e.g. team culture surveys, management and leadership trainings, career development programs, and performance review practices)
  • Be as a trusted resource to leadership and team members by handling questions related to people policies, programs, and procedures, including benefits, leave of absence, disability, and workers’ compensation
  • Develop, implement, and maintain best-in-class HR policies and processes that are compliant with state and federal regulations and updating them in our company handbook

The right person for this position will have:

  • Enthusiasm and belief in the ConvertKit mission.
  • A strong belief in diversity, equity, and inclusion, including practical knowledge of best practices to improve our culture through DE&I
  • Excellent knowledge of HR best practices and industry standards, particularly with regard to compliance, employee benefits, onboarding, employee relations
  • Ability to think strategically with a passion for building and growing cohesive teams. Experience developing and implementing successful initiatives for performance management, coaching, and learning and development.
  • Experience managing HR vendors/software
  • Strong social and emotional intelligence – you enjoy cultivating relationships with all types of people
  • An orientation towards team success over individual success and an ability to solve problems with a positive attitude
  • Integrity with the ability to manage confidential information and sensitive situations with the highest level of discretion and judgment
  • An approachable and caring manner that encourages trust and vulnerability within the team
  • 5+ years experience in human resources or people operations at a SaaS company
  • High degree of attention to detail
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Strong analytical, planning, organizational and time management skills
  • Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with or comfort in working as part of a remote team

BENEFITS

  • 3 weeks paid vacation, 8 paid holidays, and 1 week of paid sick leave / year, bumping up to 4 weeks vacation after 1 year of employment
  • The team gathers twice a year in-person for fantastic team retreats
  • 12 weeks paid leave for birthing parents / 4 weeks paid leave for non-birthing parents, as well as flexible scheduling in the first year after your child is born
  • $2,500 equipment allowance given every 2 years
  • 4% 401k match
  • Yearly conference credit
  • $1,000 yearly “paid paid vacation” bonus
  • Excellent health, vision, and dental benefits

ConvertKit is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in all of its forms and we hire the best person for each role, no matter your personal background. Research tells us that applicants who are female or non-binary, as well as applicants who are people of color, are less likely to apply for roles they do not feel 100% qualified for.

We encourage every person who is interested to apply. We’re imperfect communicators, so think of this job posting as the starting point for discussion rather than proof that you shouldn’t apply. Take the leap – you never know, you might just be the perfect person for the role, even if you don’t match 100% of the job description above.

Description

Do you have in-depth knowledge of contemporary romance? Are you eager to put that expertise to good use and earn a consistent income?

If so, then this could very well be your next paid writing gig!

 

* Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced contemporary romance writers. Please note, this role is looking for those with ample experience within contemporary romance, those without solid experience won’t qualify. Also, please be aware that writers must be US/Canada based. Exceptions can be made if you’re a brilliant writer from a native English speaking country.

We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects week after week! We offer consistent work without having to apply for jobs, with the work coming to you.

If you are someone that takes pride in their work and is looking to earn a regular income doing what you love, while also working from the comfort of your home or office, then you may be in luck!

 

* The Company

As a company, our brand is synonymous with the highest quality of writing and great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to that. We are thrilled about this and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus isn't just on our clients, but also on the team that helps make this happen. We love our team and are dedicated to creating an enjoyable work environment. Our working relationship ensures we can keep their calendars full of exciting projects whilst providing them with a steady income.

In return, our writers make sure that every client receives an outstanding experience from start to finish. As a collective, we're always looking for ways to improve our process. Our commitment to quality is an aspect of our brand we're always looking to improve, and is part of the reason our company has continued to grow.

 

* Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k up to 150k words.

Our busier writers earn $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies and other gigs. 

 

* Our Requirements

We're looking for contemporary romance writers with a good skill level, who are familiar with similar paced roles. Partnered with a good understanding of contemporary romance conventions, we also need writers who understand the intricacies of contemporary romance as well. 

 

* Desired Bonus Subgenres/Themes

Within contemporary romance, we currently have the most demand for writers that write contemporary romance stories with any of the following additional subgenres/themes hybrids:

  • Alpha male character
  • Bully romance
  • Billionaire romance
  • Paranormal

 

* Here's what's required to be part of our team

  • You write amazing romance stories. With a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
  • You are US/Canada based, or exceptional writer from a different native English country.
  • You can work with deadlines. We typically deliver 15k words in 1 week/ week and a half.
  • You are knowledgeable in contemporary romance themes/tropes. You understand the readers, you understand the conventions and you can write to market.

  • You are looking for a long-term gig and are eager & available to start.
  • You are available throughout the day to respond to team and client messages on our platform.
  • You are reliable, well-spoken, open to constructive criticism and a good communicator.

Important: Please submit relevant samples for contemporary romance and samples for any of the bonus subgenres/themes we mentioned above. If you’re successful, we’ll hire you based on your ability to write and your understanding of contemporary romance conventions. We put a lot of emphasis on this as it's vital to understand what the reader wants.

We’ll prioritize those who can commit to at least 3-6 months of work. This is because we love to establish long-term relationships with our team, and also because our clients love to create a series of projects with the same writer. 

Also, you must be able to sit down and write in order to meet deadlines. Good planning should make this easier. Again, availability throughout the day to respond to messages on our platform is essential.
